head.supplied: 5/10/66 ¶ Dear Mr Fitzgibbon ¶ ¶ Allow me to mention, that a path is much wanted across Richmond Park from the bridge of this Garden to the Promenade buildings. It would merely need to have the grass...

div.p: No. 2053, unit 733, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Allow me to mention, that a path is much wanted across Richmond Park from the bridge of this Garden to the Promenade buildings. It would merely need to have the grass turf taken off to a narrow width and along a gentle curve & this could be done at an expense of about ten pounds. It would be especially a benefit at dark nights, when the bridge cannot be readily seen.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. Mueller
M's letter was read at a meeting of the Melbourne City Council Health Committee, 21 November 1866 who could not recommend the expenditure at present (Unit 1, VPRS 4039, PROV).
